ygData.subject: Re: (ALL MAXIMALS READ) Re: Why attack? / Maximal Meeting
ygData.msgSnippet: Lunarpine saw the worried look on her face. He followed her outside, He made the right decision, your abilities give you an advantage we could never have. He

From: "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@...>

Lunarpine saw the worried look on her face. He followed her outside, "He
made the right decision, your abilities give you an advantage we could never
have." He knew that she'd never led before, but now she had an edge. If
she'd stop thinking like a recon bot. "I'll be at your side when the time
comes. I've got confidence in you." he smiled and pet het along her back.
She was no longer a typical recon bot she was now a prototype for Veratis'
new life. She is now stronger than she was, faster than she was, and even
more powerfull than she was. If she got her confidence up she'd be able to
lead as well as the rest.

OOC did I tell you that Icebirds function happens to be mutant commander?

BIC Veratis radiod ahead to the compartment where the maximal transport pod
was kept." Razor Claw, Ice, and Lunarpine will be there shortly."

Foxfingers tinkered with the control settings. He knew better than to take
chances of showing his face at the CF again without good reason. He'd stolen
from them and he was sure that they wouldn't be happy about it.
He completed the preflight checklist and doublechecked the coordinates, "All
set, they can lift off whenever they're ready."

Razor Claw was outfitted with a DNA collector. The device was a probe
extending from the hand, attached internally to a power supply box equipped
with transmitter, the information from anybody he touched would be sent
directly back to Veratis. The plan was brilliant.



----- Original Message -----
From: <logomorph@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, November 27, 2000 1:34 PM
Subject: (ALL MAXIMALS READ) Re: Why attack? / Maximal Meeting


> Ice::
>
> She looked at Veratis. She knew what he was thinking.  He was right,
> She could sent out commander faster with thought. She nodded. "I
> won't say a word about who I am." she smiled. She was glad at the
> chance to see her old friends again. Even if she couldn't tell them
> who she really was. She looked at Lunarpine and RazorClaw.  I'll do
> my best."
>
> She took the DNA collector and put it in her hip compartment.  She
> transformed into polar bear mode and walked out of the room. She was
> staring to get nervous. She had never been a leader. She didn't have
> what it took to be a leader. She was a recon bot. Not a leader of a
> team. She sighted. Why couldn't Veratis have picked another bot who
> had experience in this, like Lunarpine or RazorClaw, she thought.
>
> She walked down the hall and stopped near the entrance. She wasn't
> really ready for this. But she didn't want to tell the others that.
>
>
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > Foxfingers still has his comm programed for Maximal
> >
> > Foxfingers listens curiously as the call to report to the CF comes
> through.
> > "Veratis, I know you're busy but I thought you might want to hear
> this." He
> > replays the message for the four bots in the classroom, "Give you
> any
> > ideas?"
> >
> > Veratis stretches his back, slightly extending his bat wings. "I
> think we
> > should be included in this meeting, it'll give us the chance to get
> more
> > aquainted with our new associates." He tries not to think to
> heavily on the
> > subject knowing that strong emotions could be read by Ice. "I think
> it's
> > time to give you a field test." He looks over the three in the
> classroom
> > surveying his possabilities. "Ice, I'm putting you in charge, don't
> tell
> > them who you were or where you came from, I still don't fully trust
> anyone
> > with my technology."
> >
> > Lunarpine stood up as if to voice his objections when Veratis cut
> him off in
> > mid thought, "Ice can pick things up in thier minds before they can
> react to
> > it." Still seeing the need to justify his decision he continues "Her
> > telepathy can relay orders faster than either of you can call them
> out, and
> > She will be able to cover your backs more efficiently than you."
> >
> > Lunarpine didn't have to say a word, he knew that Veratis didn't
> mean
> > "could" The old science bot was right when he assumed that
> Lunarpine might
> > hesitate to cover Razor Claw. That one revelation put the choice
> into a new
> > light. The wolf knew that Veratis had made the only logical
> decision.
> >
> > Razor Claw stood and faced the old bot, "What is  my role in this
> mission?"
> > He had no knowlege of the Maximal units so he didn't know what he
> could
> > offer the team.
> >
> > "You have the strength they might need if they get into a messy
> situation."
> > He checked what limited information he had on the new member of the
> team,
> > "I'm placing you as Ice's bodygaurd, your shield can protect her if
> there's
> > trouble.:" He again checked his notes, "You will all de given a  DNA
> > recorder. Any bot you will come in contact with will be sent back
> to me.
> > I've set the devices on a changing frequency to make it harder to
> trace." he
> > looked to Ice again, "Try to protect my prototype, I'd like her
> returned in
> > one piece."
>
>
>
